page.title: 13Life in Newton
page.content: Newton is a small,pleasant village with a peaceful atmosphere.The spirit of village life remains with fetes, flower shows,whist drives and barbecues held in a field or the village hall.As most families have 1 car,the hourly bus service appears adequate.Children also enjoy village life.As Christine says,"With friendly neighbours you need never fear leaving your back door unlocked.Farmers allow children to explore." Helen enjoys helping grandad on the farm."In winter I feed the cattle;when we are hay making,I bring Dad his tea." Alison goes to Sunday School where "...the meeting starts in one church and finishes in the other," and she "..goes sledging in a farmer's field." The United Reform Church and the C of E hold joint services though neither has a resident minister.
